Issues.Title: HtmlParser incorrectly reports end tags (@angular/compiler)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package: `@angular/compiler` ### Is this a regression? Not sure ### Description The Angular HTML parser incorrectly reports end tags for elements. I'm not sure what this could affect internally (other than incorrect reporting of html source code locations for users), but seems like something that should be fixed to make sure downstream functionality works correctly. It's also affecting the codemod tooling that I'm building on top of Angular's HTML parser (which is how I discovered the issue). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` import { HtmlParser } from '@angular/compiler'; const parser = new HtmlParser(); const ast = parser.parse(`
`, 'tmp.html'); console.log(ast); ``` StackBlitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-vfni6r?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts The AST shows the `` element having an end tag of `` (via its `endSourceSpan`), and the `
` element has an `endSourceSpan` of `null` (signifying that it has no end tag) ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** StackBlitz / Angular v9.0.6

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): consistently delegate to TypeScript host for typing files
Issues.Body:
When ngcc is compiling an entry-point, it uses a `ReflectionHost` that
is specific to its format, e.g. ES2015, ES5, UMD or CommonJS. During the
compilation of that entry-point however, the reflector may be used to
reflect into external libraries using their declaration files.

Up until now this was achieved by letting all `ReflectionHost` classes
consider their parent class for reflector queries, thereby ending up in
the `TypeScriptReflectorHost` that is a common base class for all
reflector hosts. This approach has proven to be prone to bugs, as
failing to call into the base class would cause incompatibilities with
reading from declaration files.

The observation can be made that there's only two distinct kinds of
reflection host queries:
1. the reflector query is about code that is part of the entry-point
   that is being compiled, or
2. the reflector query is for an external library that the entry-point
   depends on, in which case the information is reflected
   from the declaration files.

The `ReflectionHost` that was chosen for the entry-point should serve
only reflector queries for the first case, whereas a regular
`TypeScriptReflectionHost` should be used for the second case. This
avoids avoids the problem where a format-specific `ReflectionHost` fails
to handle the second case correctly, as it isn't even considered for
such reflector queries.

This commit introduces a `ReflectionHost` that delegates to the
`TypeScriptReflectionHost` for AST nodes within declaration files,
otherwise delegating to the format-specific `ReflectionHost`.

Fixes #35078
Resolves FW-1859
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ngcc): consistently delegate to TypeScript host for typing files" (#36089)

Issues.Title: Getting `Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type` when using the disabled attribute
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler or a package related to templates (not sure) ### Is this a regression? I didn't test on older versions but I think this issue was always there ### Description I have a component with a optional property `user?: User` and a method, `processUser`, that processes that user. Of course, because the `user` property is optional I have to check that in my method: ```html ``` ```ts processUser(){ if(!this.user){ return } // ... process here } ``` Then I got the idea to make the `processUser` take the user parameter by passing it in the template: ```html ``` ```ts processUser(user: User){ // ... now the processUser is cleaner } ``` This works in dev mode but it will scream when building for prod with: ``` Argument of type 'User | undefined' is not assignable to parameter of type 'User'. ``` This is great since this is protecting us. All I have to do is to add an `*ngIf` to my button: ```html ``` The problem raises when I want to use the `disabled` attribute on the button instead of `*ngIf`, because removing the button from the UI looks weird in my deisgn: ```html ``` I now get the error above even if the user, technically, cannot click the button because it is disabled. Is it possible to make the template parser check for the disabled attribute and if it's true, not to check the `(click)` event? if not, what is possible workaround? PS. _This issue might also be a feature request_ ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [Stackblitz link](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-zr6f8m?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts) ## üî• Exception or Error 



Argument of type 'User | undefined' is not assignable to parameter of type 'User'.

Issues.Title: build: fix ts-api-guardian golden approval not working on windows
Issues.Body:
Currently on Windows, it's not possible to approve goldens in
`ts-api-guardian`. This is because paths are resolved relatively
to the working directory. In Windows, golden files are resolved
to the actual workspace directory. The current logic tries to
compute a relative path to the runfile from the working directory.

This causes the file paths to have a lot of parent directory
path segments. Eventually, when joined with the build workspace
directory, the paths end up being incorrect. e.g.

```
fileName = ../../../../../../projects/angular/golden/<..>/common.d.ts`
outFile = BUILD_WORKSPACE_DIR + fileName;
```

To fix this, we no longer deal with confusing relative paths, but
instead always use absolute file system paths.

Additionally, this fixes that new goldens are generated at the wrong
location on all platforms.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix ts-api-guardian golden approval not working on windows" (#36096)

Issues.Title: Access custom Component from its associated formControl in another Component
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package I extracted my issue into a small git repo: https://github.com/lovefamilychildrenhappiness/AngularCustomComponentValidation And I provided a descriptive explanation on SO but haven't gotten any workable solutions: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60724475/change-the-css-class-of-custom-component-from-another-component As the git repo illustrates, the affected package is Angular8 and AngularForms. ### Is this a regression? I am not aware of whether it worked in previous versions. ### Description As I explained in the SO post, I have a custom component. This custom component is referenced in another component. This other component handles the reactive form data. Consequently, when I click a button (not a submit form button) in this other component, I can fetch the specific formControl associated with the custom component. But if the formControl is not valid (it is blank), then I need to add a css class to the custom component. Note that the formControl has a Validators.required validation on it already, and the custom component implements both NG_VALUE_ACCESSOR and NG_VALIDATORS. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/lovefamilychildrenhappiness/AngularCustomComponentValidation --> ## üî• Exception or Error There are no exceptions. There is no way I am aware of to access the component in another component by its related formControl. I report it has a bug because this is a fundamental necessity in web development (without being able to change the css class based on some condition, it's not a web framework), and I spent over 5 hours searching feverishly for a solution to no avail. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): handle type references to namespace imports correctly
Issues.Body:
When the compiler needs to convert a type reference to a value
expression, it has to deal with various import forms one of which is a
namespace import. A namespace import exposes the types and namespaces
contained within the imported namespace that can then be referred to
using various forms. For example, given `import * as ns from 'foo'`:

1. One can refer to the namespace as type: `ns`. Such a reference cannot
   be converted into a value, as it's deemed illegal to refer to a
   namespace as a value.
2. One can refer to a type within the namespace: `ns.Foo`. The value
   representation of this would be `i0.Foo`, where `i0` is a synthesized
   namespace import of the `foo` module (just like `ns` is).
3. One can refer to a type in a nested namespace within `ns`:
   `ns.Foo.Bar` and possibly even deeper nesting. The value expression
   for this would be `i0.Foo.Bar`, with `i0` being the same as in 2.

Before this change, the compiler only dealt with case 2 correctly. The
other cases would crash the compiler. This is undesirable, however, as
case 3 would be a valid value and case 1 would not show where the
problem occurs. Additionally, a type-to-value conversion would be
irrelevant when an explicit injection token is provided using `@Inject`,
so referring to a namespace in a type position (case 1) could still be
valid.

This commit introduces logic to the type-to-value conversion to
introduce the ability to properly deal with cases 1 and 3.

Fixes #36006
Resolves FW-1995
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler): handle type references to namespace imports correctly" (#36106)

"Checkmarx Research Team", "email": "" }, "reported_by": { "link": "https://www.checkmarx.com/resources/blog/", "name": "Checkmarx Research Team", "email": "" }, "module_name": "minimist", "cves": [], "vulnerable_versions": "<1.2.3", "patched_versions": ">=1.2.3", "overview": "Versions of `minimist` prior to 1.2.3 are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Arguments are not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to modify the prototype of `Object`, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects. Parsing the argument `--__proto__.y=Polluted` adds a `y` property with value `Polluted` to all objects. The argument `--__proto__=Polluted` raises and uncaught error and crashes the application. This is exploitable if attackers have control over the arguments being passed to `minimist`.\n", "recommendation": "Upgrade to version 1.2.3 or later.", "references": "", "access": "public", "severity": "moderate", "cwe": "CWE-471", "metadata": { "module_type": "", "exploitability": 2, "affected_components": "" }, "url": "https://npmjs.com/advisories/1179" } }, "muted": [], "metadata": { "vulnerabilities": { "info": 0, "low": 0, "moderate": 53, "high": 0, "critical": 0 }, "dependencies": 55, "devDependencies": 16915, "optionalDependencies": 307, "totalDependencies": 16971 }, "runId": "5d8a80c9-aa1c-4ee5-a685-05728b8d67b0" } ```

Issues.Title: Service Worker - handle redirects
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/service-worker


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...


Without the service worker we redirect the `navigate` request with 302 to the authentication and then either to the login or back to the document.
When we enable the service worker the `index.html` is obviously cached, therefore the request never happens.

Would it be possible to configure service worker to somehow handle the 3xx requests?


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
For `navigate` requests try the network first, fall back to the cache, finally the offline page.

Something like:

```ts
if (isNavigationRequest(request)) {
  const navigateRequest = new Request(url, {
    method: 'GET',
    headers: request.headers,
    mode: request.mode == 'navigate' ? 'cors' : request.mode,
    credentials: request.credentials,
    redirect: request.redirect
  });

  event.respondWith(
    fetch(navigateRequest)
      .then(/*NETWORK - cache the result*/)
      .catch(/*Use from cache*/);
  );
}
```

This could be hidden behind the flag in ngsw-config.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

We could probably exclude `index.html` from caching but that's not a good idea as offline mode wont work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Service Worker - handle redirects" (#36099)

Issues.Title: ci: cache downloaded bazel version in circleci
Issues.Body:
Similarly to what is done in `angular/components`, we should
cache the downloaded Bazel version (from `bazelisk`).

This reduces the overhead of downloading Bazel, and also avoids
the dependency on the external download server. We should avoid
external server dependencies as much as possible (see how the yarn
registry was flaky in the past).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ci: cache downloaded bazel version in circleci" (#36098)

Issues.Title: @angular/pwa leads to routes being handled by angular where they should've been handled by the reverse proxy instead
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? I don't think so. ### Description nginx is the reverse proxy in the front before: - keycloak IDP was on a separate subdomain and domain (https://connect.otherdomain.tld/) - https://github.com/manfredsteyer/angular-oauth2-oidc is used as an oidc client. - local api accessible under local domain `/api/v1/*` when I write local domain, I mean domain.tld (e.g. example.com) no issues now: - keycloak IDP is on the same local domain mounted under `/auth/` (https://domain.tld/auth/) - http api is also mounted, as before under `/api/v1/*` When the ngsw... service worker is registered and active, the mentioned error appears after clicking on the login button/link. When I press unregister and try that button/link again there are no issues. This does NOT happen in dev, only prod, which makes sense, since I'm using the remote connect.domain.tld IDP. SameSite cookies are coming soonTM. ngsw-config.json ```json { "$schema": "./node_modules/@angular/service-worker/config/schema.json", "index": "/index.html", "assetGroups": [ { "name": "app", "installMode": "prefetch", "resources": { "files": [ "/favicon.ico", "/index.html", "/manifest.webmanifest", "/*.css", "/*.js" ] } }, { "name": "assets", "installMode": "lazy", "updateMode": "prefetch", "resources": { "files": [ "/assets/**", "/*.(eot|svg|cur|jpg|png|webp|gif|otf|ttf|woff|woff2|ani)" ] } } ] } ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Almost Impossible. Would require a live domain with a configured IDP for that domain which is mounted locally under the /auth/ URL prefix, then configuring that oauth/oidc client to use that, add a button to login, ng add @angular/pwa, publish to some web host to then try and login twice while the service worker is active ## üî• Exception or Error 

Error: Uncaught (in promise): Error: Cannot match any routes. URL Segment: 'auth/realms/some.realm/protocol/openid-connect/auth'
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.0.6
Node: 12.16.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 9.0.6
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router, service-worker
Ivy Workspace: Yes

-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.900.6
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.900.6
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.900.6
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.900.6
@angular-devkit/core              9.0.6
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.0.6
@angular/cdk                      9.1.2
@angular/flex-layout              9.0.0-beta.29
@angular/material                 9.1.2
@ngtools/webpack                  9.0.6
@schematics/angular               9.0.6
@schematics/update                0.900.6
rxjs                              6.5.4
typescript                        3.7.5
webpack                           4.41.2
**Anything else relevant?** This happens on chromium linux does not happen on chrome linux and it does happen on chrome linux happens on chrome android happens on firefox android does not happen on firefox linux I've also opened an issue https://github.com/manfredsteyer/angular-oauth2-oidc/issues/750

export class AppModule {

    }

        if (!customElements.get(`my-app`)) {

    }

Issues.Title: fix(common): let `KeyValuePipe` accept type unions with `null`
Issues.Body:
`KeyValuePipe` currently accepts `null` values as well as `Map`s and a
few others. However, due to the way in which TS overloads work, a type
of `T|null` will not be accepted by `KeyValuePipe`'s signatures, even
though both `T` and `null` individually would be.

To make this work, each signature that accepts some type `T` has been
duplicated with a second one below it that accepts a `T|null` and
includes `null` in its return type.

Fixes #35743
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(common): let `KeyValuePipe` accept type unions with `null`" (#36093)

Issues.Title: Custom class annotations don't work in production build after update to NG9
Issues.Body:
Custom annotations are not called at all in production build after updating to Angular 9.  
When testing it with **ng serve** it works as usual.  
No errors in the console.

My custom annotation:
```
@CustomSmartForm('calculatorForm')
@Component({
selector: 'calculator-form',
...
})
export class CalculatorFormComponent implements OnInit {...}
```
The function which should be called every time an annotation is set on a component:
```
import * as _ from 'lodash';

export function CustomSmartForm(formId: string) {
    return (target: any) => {
        const glb: any = window;
        glb.__smart_form_definitions = glb.__smart_form_definitions || {};
        const scope = glb.__smart_form_definitions;
        _.set(scope, formId, target);
    };
}
```
But it is not called for all components and I don't know why.   
This only happens in production build.  
Using lodash, this function sets the class definition on the object *scope* on the path *formId*.  
From this object I try to retrieve the class definitions by formId later in the function below:
```
function getCustomFormDefinition(formId: string): any {
    const scope = (<any> window).__smart_form_definitions;
    return scope && scope[formId];
}
```
Dependencies and dev-dependencies:
```

This is duplicate of https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/14815

The fix isn't provided by cli yet.

# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
The previous versions don't have the Differential Loading concept

### Description

When updating from 7 to 8:
The angular schematic that does the migration drops all polyfills of array functions

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/9c4da54b63ed2fe526355c937952aaba3b888497/packages/schematics/angular/migrations/update-8/drop-es6-polyfills.ts#L33

but the angular 8 cli polyfills doesn't include the polyfill
`import 'core-js/modules/es.array.includes';`

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/9c4da54b63ed2fe526355c937952aaba3b888497/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/es5-polyfills.js#L37

the workaround is manually adding the missing polyfill to polyfills.ts.

looking for a fix from angular team.

                {
                  "type": "initial",
                  "maximumWarning": "2mb",
                  "maximumError": "6mb"
                }
              ]
            }
          }
```

Notice that, I have two configurations `production` and `srcmap` with `"buildOptimizer": true`
the only difference is the sourcemap. where
* `production` : `sourceMap: false`
* `srcmap`: `"sourceMap": { "hidden": true, "scripts": true,"styles": true          }`

If I run, `ng build --prod` and `ng build --configuration=srcmap` 
I get bundles with difference in their hashes. 

According to the following issue, the above said bug shouldn't be happening because I am already using hidden sourcemap

related to https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/8981 


**When I change to `buildOptimizer: false` in both `production` and `srcmap` then I run the build for both  and then I get similar bundles.**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "file hash different when building with and without sourcemaps when buildOptimizer set to true" (#17237)

# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->

### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: v7


### Description

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem...
This issue complains about below in the polyfills.ts

```
/***************************************************************************************************
 * Load `$localize` onto the global scope - used if i18n tags appear in Angular templates.
 */
import '@angular/localize/init';
```

This is added after running the command ng add "@angular/localize"

Seems like it cannot find this import of the polyfills when I run, ng test. is there a way or options that can be added in the command to provide this localize configuration explicitly.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
below is the configuration , I am having after the the upgrade to angular 9.


tsconfig.app.json
```
{

  "compilerOptions": {
    "outDir": "../out-tsc/app",
    "types": []
  },

    "polyfills.ts"
  ],
  "include": [

  ],
  "exclude": [
    "src/test.ts",
    "**/*.spec.ts"
  ]
}
```

```
{

  "compilerOptions": {
    "baseUrl": "./",
    "downlevelIteration": true,
    "importHelpers": true,
    "module": "esnext",
    "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
    "sourceMap": true,
    "declaration": false,
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "emitDecoratorMetadata": true,
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    "allowSyntheticDefaultImports": true,
    "target": "es2015",
    "typeRoots": [

    ],
    "lib": [
      "es2018",
      "dom"
    ],
    "skipLibCheck": true
  }
}
```

## üî• Exception or Error

```
core.js:47866 Uncaught Error: It looks like your application or one of its dependencies is using i18n.
Angular 9 introduced a global `$localize()` function that needs to be loaded.
Please run `ng add @angular/localize` from the Angular CLI.
(For non-CLI projects, add `import '@angular/localize/init';` to your `polyfills.ts` file.
For server-side rendering applications add the import to your `main.server.ts` file.)
    at core.js:47866

https://github.com/alexkaufman06/Quizatron/commits/Update-to-Angular-9 

After this update, I started getting the following error when running `ng lint`

An unhandled exception occurred: error TS6053: File 'tsconfig.json' not found.

Issues.Title: Bundle calculator assumes bundle size configs otherwise reduce fails on empty array
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [ ] new
- [X ] build
- [ ] serve
- [X ] test
- [X ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [X ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?

The bug was introduced by this commit:
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/770de947c88a0fcac8c0948df655fe8ec2b37d0b#diff-86d5f24a73f7db8e65c3e66c4dab5205

### Description

Our project does not have budgets set for all configurations. After upgrading to Angular 9, it cannot be built because of the following exception during the build process.

Calls to `Array.reduce` functions are missing default values here https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/9.0.x/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.ts


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

We do not any simple reproducer, however the bug is obvious from the code directly.

## üî• Exception or Error

```
[error] TypeError: Reduce of empty array with no initial value
    at Array.reduce (<anonymous>)
    at Object.values.map (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.js:151:18)
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at BundleCalculator.calculate (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.js:147:65)
    at calculateSizes (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.js:101:23)
    at Object.checkBudgets (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.js:271:23)
    at checkBudgets.next (<anonymous>)
    at BundleBudgetPlugin.runChecks (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/plugins/bundle-budget.js:22:40)
    at compiler.hooks.afterEmit.tap (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/plugins/bundle-budget.js:14:18)
    at _next0 (eval at create (/project/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), <anonymous>:19:1)
    at _err0 (eval at create (/project/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), <anonymous>:44:1)
    at compiler.hooks.afterEmit.tapAsync (/project/node_modules/copy-webpack-plugin/dist/index.js:115:7)
    at AsyncSeriesHook.eval [as callAsync] (eval at create (/project/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), <anonymous>:40:1)
    at AsyncSeriesHook.lazyCompileHook (/project/node_modules/tapable/lib/Hook.js:154:20)
    at asyncLib.forEachLimit.err (/project/node_modules/webpack/lib/Compiler.js:482:27)
    at /project/node_modules/neo-async/async.js:2818:7


```


## üåç Your Environment

Even after adding the default budgets config, it still fails.

```
"budgets": [
                {
                  "type": "anyComponentStyle",
                  "maximumWarning": "6kb"
                }
              ]

```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bundle calculator assumes bundle size configs otherwise reduce fails on empty array" (#17215)

Issues.Title: fr(Tab): Add setter for _contentPortal property
Issues.Body:
#### Add setter method for _contentPortal property

If we want to extend functionality of MatTab class, we need to set _contentPortal property, wich is a private property. It has a getter method but not a setter method. So adding a getter we will can extend MatTab class and make a component with our requirements.

#### Use Case

In case you need to modify or extend MatTab behaviour, but maintaining rest of functionality.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "fr(Tab): Add setter for _contentPortal property" (#18850)

Issues.Title: bug(datepicker): disabled datepicker is not working in IE11
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
StackBlitz is currently not working on IE.
This is reproducible on https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/examples ('Disabled Datepicker' example)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/examples in IE
2. The 'Disabled Datepicker' example is not working and there is a console error

```
ERROR Error: Unexpected call to method or property access.
```

 
#### Expected Behavior

Datepicker should be displayed in disabled state.


#### Actual Behavior

Nothing is displayed and there is error on console.

The issue seems to be in `set disabled(..) {}` when `element.blur()` is called.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.6
- CDK/Material: 9.1.2
- Browser(s): IE11
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(datepicker): disabled datepicker is not working in IE11" (#18839)

Issues.Title: bug(material/table): style messy and buggy with Angular Mat-Table
Issues.Body:
Reproduction
I have create a github repo for this performance issue from angular material, here is the link https://github.com/jimkeecn/buildxactDemo

the problem in the repo is. I have created an angular element with a mat-input and mat-table. after building the angular element and used in other project. the mat-input is buggy, the placeholder will not move up while the input is focus and filled. Also the pagination of the mat-table is not working at the very start until i have trigger some detect change, however the pagination has slow reaction after click and werid styling and flicking of texts.

Steps to reproduce:

download the repo.
open the index.html in folder /I am outside of the project/
you will see the performance of the angular material input and table.
the component is actually in library project folder /search-page
angular element is in external project folder /app-component

Expected Behavior
I was expecting the mat-table pagination is working, and pagination button is clickable.

Actual Behavior
Mat-Table
pagination forward and backward button is not clickable
pagination dropdown is not clickable

Environment
Angular: ~9.0.3
Angular/elements: ^9.0.4
CDK/Material: ^9.1.0
Browser(s): Chrome
Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(material/table): style messy and buggy with Angular Mat-Table" (#18837)

Issues.Title: docs(a11y): update high contrast description in readme
Issues.Body:
Updates an outdated description about how the high contrast detection works.

Fixes #18148.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs(a11y): update high contrast description in readme" (#18836)

Issues.Title: bug(Expansion Panel): Custom icon in header does not animate
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-3n3zkm

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click expansion panel header, icon will rotate, however the transition does not animate.

* There is a workaround.  If the transition is defined in css the animation works correctly.  To see this in the above stackblitz uncomment the animation-workaround class and remove the transition line from the component.
 
#### Expected Behavior
Icon should animate based on transition property.

#### Actual Behavior
Icon rotates, no animation occurs.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Expansion Panel): Custom icon in header does not animate" (#18833)

Issues.Title: fix(table): error when nesting tables
Issues.Body:
Previously we used to support nesting tables, but in v9 we had to make some changes in order to handle all cases in Ivy. As a result, nesting was broken due to parent tables picking up the cell definitions of their children. These changes add some logic to account for tables being nested.

Fixes #18768.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(table): error when nesting tables" (#18832)

Issues.Title: fix(bottom-sheet): allow result to be passed when dismissing through service
Issues.Body: A bottom sheet can be dismissed both through the bottom sheet ref and the service, but we only allow a result to be passed through the ref. These changes add a paramter to the service as well.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(bottom-sheet): allow result to be passed when dismissing through service" (#18831)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): add feature targeting to theme styles
Issues.Body: The MDC chips theme was including some styles without a feature target, resulting in some unnecessary styles being added.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): add feature targeting to theme styles" (#18830)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): handle custom preview/placeholder with multiple root nodes
Issues.Body: We support passing in a custom preview or placeholder using an `ng-template`, but we were only taking the first `rootNode` from the template.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): handle custom preview/placeholder with multiple root nodes" (#18829)

Issues.Title: refactor(cdk): use overloads to indicate deprecated constructor signatures
Issues.Body:
Historically we've been using `@deprecated` on constructor paramters to indicate when they're going to become required. This is incorrect, because it won't show up in tooling that looks for breaking changes.

These changes reworks all of the deprecated constructor signatures in the CDK to use overloads.

This PR is intended as a test run to see if there are any issues with the approach, before we can roll it out to Material which has a lot more constructor deprecations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(cdk): use overloads to indicate deprecated constructor signatures" (#18828)

Issues.Title: fix(dialog): recapture focus when clicking on backdrop when closing is disabled
Issues.Body:
`MatDialog` has an option to disable closing by clicking on the backdrop, but this can lead to focus being bumped back to the `body` and allowing users to tab past the dialog. These changes add some extra logic to recapture focus when the user clicks on the backdrop.

Fixes #18799.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(dialog): recapture focus when clicking on backdrop when closing is disabled" (#18826)

Issues.Title: fix(form-field): some input types taller than plain text input
Issues.Body:
Fixes the time, date etc. input types being taller than the plain text input by a couple of pixels due to the native input masking.

Fixes #18787.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(form-field): some input types taller than plain text input" (#18825)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "fr(datepicker): Allow changing format of the days shown as column headers" (#18824)
